Archives.ChaliceOfOpulence.Description:
A tool that enables users to rapidly discover required rune combinations for specific rewards from _The Menagerie_, an activity from Destiny 2's Season of Opulence.

_The Menagerie_ is a vast prison-like museum located in the lower decks of Calus's Leviathan. It served as an enclosure to all the different species Calus collected amidst his journeys, including the Hive, Vex, and Arkborn, and pits them against the Guardians invited aboard for their pleasure and glory as well as his own entertainment.
Archives.ChaliceOfOpulence.Name: Chalice of Opulence
Archives.Grimoire.Description:
The lore of old, Destiny 1's Grimoire cards are backed up, archived, and preserved here. Grimoire is a database within Destiny. Entries were unlocked through playing the game in the form of "cards."

The list of Grimoire entries is sorted into six main categories—Guardian, Inventory, Allies, Enemies, Places, and Activities. Each of these categories has a number of sub-categories.
Archives.Grimoire.Name: Grimoire
Auth.Data.Description: Delete the authentication data stored on your device. While unnecessary, this function is provided for your peace of mind.

Auth.Error.NoAuth.Description:
Some features of Braytech require your written permission to activate, generally to protect your privacy.

To use this feature, please tell Bungie that you approve. No personal information is shared by doing so—only an authentication code with which you may interact with more API endpoints.

Clans are optional groups of friends that enhance your online gaming experience. Coordinate with your clanmates to take on co-op challenges or just simply represent them in your solo play to earn extra rewards.

Join your friend's clan, meet some new friends, or create your own on the companion app or at bungie.net.

Event.FestivalOfTheLost.Description: Laugh in the face of death, collect candies, wear masks, and fight back against the encroaching darkness.
Event.FestivalOfTheLost.Name: Festival of the Lost
Event.IronBanner.Description: A special week-long Crucible event that challenges teams of six to go head-to-head in the most competitive form of Control.
Event.SolsticeOfHeroes.Description:
The annual tradition to honor the sacrifices of Guardians everywhere has come again. Eva has returned to the Tower and awaits you near the Statue of Heroes. Gather and celebrate the resilience of humanity’s foremost defenders.

Complete all objectives on all items in a set to unlock the next set. Complete objectives on Magnificent gear to unlock its glow, and access to others.
Event.SolsticeOfHeroes.Description.Exten:
The annual tradition to honor the sacrifices of Guardians everywhere has come again. Eva has returned to the Tower and awaits you near the Statue of Heroes. Gather and celebrate the resilience of humanity’s foremost defenders.

Fly the friendly skies of the European Aerial Zone (EAZ) and take on the Hive, Cabal, and Fallen. Once you’ve dispatched your foes in this three-player matchmade activity, set out across the EAZ in search of treasure chests. The more bosses you defeat, the more rewards you’ll earn.
Event.SolsticeOfHeroes.Name: Solstice of Heroes 2020
Event.TheDawning.Description: Even the biting chill of Europa can’t freeze the warm hearts of Guardians during this special time of year. The Dawning has returned.
Event.TheDawning.Name: The Dawning
FAQ.API.StatDiscrepancy.Description:
There are multiple sources for stats in Destiny. Clan Historical Stats is based on the HistoricalStats API endpoint while others source their data from PGCRs. It's hard to determine which holds the most accurate truth.

To display stats in the manner seen on Clan Historical Stats would require downloading terabytes of data from Bungie servers and significant compute power. This said, they're accurate enough for some friendly competition.
FAQ.API.StatDiscrepancy.Name: Clan Historical Stats don't match [other thing]
Commonly asked, "What is the funny percentage to the right of collectibles and records?"

It's a percentage of players who've either discovered or redeemed the item. Every few days, _Voluspa_ collects data from users of _Braytech_ and takes note of who's got what.

It's been a hot topic as to whether it's accurate or useful and the truth is that all statistics are useless and dumb _unless_ you've included every single piece of data possible.

It's fair to assume that these stats are bias towards casual players (percentages may appear higher rather than lower due to the skill and attention of the users that are monitored).
FAQ.Braytech.ProfilePrivacy.Description:
If you're concerned for your privacy while playing Destiny and how the API exposes your progression and activities for use by third parties, you may alter your privacy settings on [Bungie.net](https://bungie.net/en/Profile/Settings/?category=Privacy).

Doing so will require that you authenticate Braytech with Bungie for continued use.
FAQ.Braytech.ProfilePrivacy.Name: Profile privacy
FAQ.Braytech.ServiceWorkerUpdate.Descrip:
From the _Settings_ view, you can try a variety of things. Start by selecting _Update Service Worker_.

If this fails, you can try reloading the app by selecting _Reload App_. If the problem continues to persist, please select _Dump Service Worker_ and report the issue via Discord.
FAQ.Braytech.ServiceWorkerUpdate.Name: Braytech won't update
FAQ.Voluspa.About.Description: _Voluspa_, named after a sub-mind of _Rasputin_, is what I've named the serverside component of Braytech. It's responsible for collating the profile data of Braytech's users for commonality statistics, settings sync, and other key features.
FAQ.Voluspa.About.Name: About Voluspa
Item.CurrentlyCantRoll: This perk can not currently roll for this weapon

Landing.Blog.Error: Blog posts couldn't be loaded at this time.
Landing.Features.Description:
Braytech is a web app that started out small. Its development has been ongoing for over two years and has seen many incremental additions and improvements. Its developer, Tom Chapman, is a fan of Destiny's design and it strongly influences the Braytech's aesthetic.

Starting out small, Braytech has grown to encompass many functions. Notably, replicating the experiences of the game's _Triumphs_ and _Collections_ views.

Today, Braytech does a lot more than just triumph records and checklists. Building all these interfaces was the first step—subsequent steps include connecting them to one another and realising the relationships between their data e.g. how quests connect to specific locations in the game world.

Need to find something quick? Press  and start typing! Braytech has a search HUD, available anywhere in the app.

Braytech is built for desktop users first, but works and looks beautiful as a mobile app. In fact, there's an [Android app](https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=braytech.org.twa) in the Play store.
Landing.Features.Name: Jack of all trades.
Landing.Onboarding.Hotline.Description: Braytech is a third-party companion app for Bungie's Destiny which enables players to track their progression and find answers to their queries through various views which mimic and elevate Destiny's own interfaces with insightful features and additional curated data.
Landing.Onboarding.Hotline.Name: Clarity Control.
Landing.Support.Description:
Braytech is a full-time job—I design and develop to improve myself and to please you. I'm anti-ads, to my own demise. Your support helps me keep the lights on and allows me to do my best work.

Join the [Discord](https://discord.braytech.org) and the other patrons in the Braytech Research Division.
Landing.Support.Name: Are you a fan? Show your support.

Maps.ProposeChanges.Form.Screenshots.Des:
Proposed screenshots must meet a strict quality criteria:
- display resolution of 1920x1080
- no visible HUD
- no visible Guardians or equipment
- no visible enemies
- maximum video settings
  - including a render resolution of 200%

Search.Suggestions:
Search supports filters as prefixes. Try `name:mida` to only match entities whereby their name value includes the term "mida."

Supported prefixes:
- name
- description
- source
- expiration

You may also search by manifest `hash`.

Results will be prioritised by name, source, and description.

UserModules.NightmareHunts.Description:
Your most feared, devastating, tormenting nightmares reincarnate―be immovable in your resolve, Guardian.

_Hunt down this week's available nightmares for... satisfaction._
UserModules.Patreon.Description:
We all hate ads. They're ugly. They're annoying. They collect your data and sell it to third parties.

Help keep them away from Braytech by supporting the app through Patreon. Whether it's a one time thing or an ongoing commitment, every couple of dollars helps!
UserModules.Patreon.Name: Keep Braytech Ad-free
UserModules.Raids.ChallengeUnavailable: The challenge couldn't be determined at this time.
UserModules.Raids.Challenges.ALinkToTheC: During the Consecrated Mind encounter, all players must refresh their Enlightened buff at approximately the same time. However, the team may be split up at different tethers.
UserModules.Raids.Challenges.AllForOneOn: Vault Access encounter: Each Guardian must grab and deposit each Phase Radiance buff once (boss must be killed in 3 damage phases).
UserModules.Raids.Challenges.ColiseumCha: Shuro Chi chase encounter: Guardians must not take damage from Shuro Chi's Arc Blast.
UserModules.Raids.Challenges.CopiesOfCop: Don't use airlocks to space Atraks's copies.
UserModules.Raids.Challenges.ForeverFigh: Morgeth encounter: don't kill smol ogres, only kill big boi.
UserModules.Raids.Challenges.Gauntlet.De: Guardians cannot stand on the same plate more than once.
UserModules.Raids.Challenges.HoldTheLine: Botza District encounter: the map generator must not fall below half charge.
UserModules.Raids.Challenges.KeepOut: Vault encounter: knights must be killed in the rooms they spawn in.
UserModules.Raids.Challenges.LimitedBles: Ritual encounter: no more than two Guardians may have the Witch's Blessing buff at one time during The Hive Ritual.
UserModules.Raids.Challenges.OfAllTrades: Over the course of the Descent encounter, each Guardian must equip each augment once. Await an augment deactivation before beginning the changeover. Play in pairs, shadowing a leader's rotation.
UserModules.Raids.Challenges.PleasureGar: Each relic holder may only shoot one plant per phase.
UserModules.Raids.Challenges.RedRover: Bypass Crypt Security while passing the Operator Augment to each fireteam member. Each Operator should activate two panels each over three damage phases.
One Guardian must remain in the middle with their feet in the water during the entire encounter.
UserModules.Raids.Challenges.StayingAliv: Complete the Consecrated Mind encounter without killing any Cyclops that spawn in the Harpy boss's presence. Cyclops that spawn in other areas, and during the final sprint, can be killed.
UserModules.Raids.Challenges.StrengthOfM: Riven encounter: Guardians must not shoot the same eye twice.
UserModules.Raids.Challenges.SummoningRi: Kalli encounter: Cleanse all nine plates, kill all nine Knights, and kill all Ogres before damaging Kalli.
UserModules.Raids.Challenges.TheCoreFour: During the final encounter, prior to each damage phase, break all four of Taniks' thrusters
UserModules.Raids.Challenges.Throne.Desc: Burn all four plates at the same time for every damage phase. Do not fire before all plates are activated.
UserModules.Raids.Challenges.Throne.Name: The Throne
UserModules.Raids.Challenges.ToEachTheir: Insurrection Prime encounter: A Guardian may not shoot and break more than one shield generator per phase.
UserModules.Raids.Challenges.ToTheTop: Must always deposit 10 motes at any time during the Consecrated Mind encounter.
UserModules.Raids.Challenges.TotalVictor: Deception encounter: break the Deception's shield 5 times during the phase in which he is defeated i.e. a single phase.
UserModules.Raids.Challenges.WithBothHan: Gahlran encounter: each Guardian may only shoot one of _the real_ Gahlran's hands once during only one of his hand raises.
UserModules.Raids.Challenges.ZeroToOneHu: During the Sanctified Mind encounter, bank 30 motes at each Vex relay. At each relay, all 30 motes must be deposited within 10 seconds of one another.
UserModules.SeasonArtifact.NoArtifactYet: Your Guardian hasn't received an artifact yet.
UserModules.SeasonArtifact.Progression.D: Earning XP grants Power bonuses and unlocks powerful mods that can be slotted into weapons and armor.
UserModules.SeasonChallenges.Name: UserModules.SeasonChallenges.Name
UserModules.SeasonPass.Name: Season Pass
UserModules.TrialsOfOsiris.Info: Begin your trials by speaking with Saint-14.
Vendor.FailureStrings.UniquenessViolatio: Can only hold one at a time

Views.Credits.Description: About the Guardians who make it possible
Views.Credits.Name: Credits
Views.Credits.Origins.Description:
Braytech has been, and continues to be, a multipurpose facility for its developer to practice and learn how to better program and work with others. It started out as a cool hobby to help pass the time and transformed into a bit of a monster.

This beast is developed by a guy from Australia, but not without the moral support and guidance of others who he'd like to describe here.

The third party developer community that grows in Destiny's backyard is a kind one that helps one another and is a beautiful thing. So, shout outs to the crew at [Destiny Item Manager](https://destinyitemmanager.com/), [Richard Deveraux](https://lowlidev.com.au/), and all the others who've kept Tom sane while he tries to do the silly things he does.
Views.Credits.Origins.Name: A Lone Wolf
